p:
The α-glucosidase inhibition activity of the sample was determined following the procedure described with minor modifications
17 . A 40-μL aliquot of α-glucosidase solution (1 U/mL) is added to 1μLof sample solution (500 μg/mL in DMSO) and 69 μL of 0.1 M sodium phosphate buffer. After 15 min incubation at 37 °C, 40 μL of substrate solution (5 mM p-nitrophenyl α-D- glucopyranoside) is added to the reaction mixture and incubated at 37 °C for 30 min. Then, the reaction is terminated by adding 150 μL of 0.1 M Na 2CO 3. The yellow product can be determined at absorbance 405 nm, using a plate reader (Biotek Synergy H1 Multi-Mode Reader, Winooski, VT, USA). The percentage of inhibition is calculated as follows:
% inhibition =
( 1 −
A
sample
/
A
control
) × 100
